Title: Series: Cabinet du Roy
Description: The flight into Egypt, with the Holy Family on the left, about to ford a river; after a drawing attributed to Annibale Carracci or to Pier Francesco Mola Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Anne Claude Philippe de Tubières, Comte de Caylus
Curator's comments: From 'Cabinet du Roy', see 1965,0319.2.1 for comment on the set and on the album. The original drawing is kept in the Département des Arts Graphiques, Louvre (Inv. 8051) where it is catalogued as a work by P. F. Mola. However, while discussing a plate engraved after the same drawing for the "Recueil Jabach", Stephen Bailey proposes to attribute it to Annibale Carracci ("Carracci landscape studies: the drawings related to the 'Recueil de 283 Estampes de Jabach'", 1993, No.11, p.144-145). Catherine Loisel did not include the Louvre drawing in her catalogue of the Carracci drawings kept in the Louvre ("Inventaire général des dessins italiens, VII : Ludovico, Agostino, Annibale Carracci", Paris, 2004).
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (163)
